analytic.title: Couvents du Nord de l’Iraq. Impressions d’une visite en 2012

biblStruct.note: In the footsteps of Fr J.-M. Fiey and under his guidance, the author of this article was able to pay a short visit to Northern Iraq, searching for architectural remains of ancient monasteries. In the first part of the article some impressions of this visit in 2012 are related. The second part is devoted to a more detailed description of three monasteries (Rabban Hormizd of the Chaldeans, Mor Matay of the Syrian Orthodox, and Mor Behnam of the Syrian Catholics) where, until the present day, some monks continue the spiritual life of their predecessors, in order to make their place an attractive center of monastic Christian devotion.

body.bibl: Vossel, Vincent van. “Couvents Du Nord de l’Iraq. Impressions d’une Visite En 2012.” Orientalia Christiana Periodica 80:1 (2014): 35–85.
Vincent van Vossel, Couvents Du Nord de l’Iraq. Impressions d’une Visite En 2012, Orientalia Christiana Periodica 80:1 (2014): 35–85.
